alert.note: Alert for Eastern Albany; Eastern Greene; Eastern Schenectady; Eastern Ulster; Montgomery; Schoharie; Western Albany; Western Greene; Western Schenectady; Western Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 5:27PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Ulster, western Schenectady, western Albany, Greene, Schoharie and southeastern Montgomery Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 527 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Bowerstown to near East Meredith to near Andes. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cobleskill, Hunter, Jefferson, Duanesburg, Woodstock, Westerlo, Berne, Altamont, Windham, Middleburgh, Gilboa, Summit, Schoharie, Richmondville, Prattsville, Sharon Springs, Delanson, Breakabeen, Livingstonville and Preston-Potter Hollow. This includes Interstate 88 between exits 20 and 25. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for eastern and east central New York.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Albany; Eastern Greene; Eastern Schenectady; Eastern Ulster; Montgomery; Schoharie; Western Albany; Western Greene; Western Schenectady; Western Ulster
